title: How to Play Making Squares

steps.headline: Make a square or rectangle of dots, as shown in this image.
Provide the players with pencils.
steps.description: Each player makes a line joining two dots but tries to prevent the others from making a square.

steps.headline: Keep playing.
steps.description: For a while it is easy, but soon the number of dots is scarce, and it requires careful marking to prevent the squares from being formed.

steps.headline: Change turns.
steps.description: Finally all the chances are gone and the next player completes a square. As a reward this player is given another chance, thus completing several, then joins two dots and the next player continues.

steps.headline: Each player places his or her initial in the completed square, so that the score is easily counted.
steps.description: The player who has succeeded in making the most squares is the winner.
